flow.descriptionCdata:
b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.0253fe91-1688-4807-8b6c-4400e6de0fc7.prompt=Enter a value for newName b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.07d63bce-cf78-46ef-a4d2-3c2b393bd449.description=
Checks to see if a path points to a directory.

Input Parameters\:
source - The path to check.
user - Username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host when reading.
password - Password for the user.

Responses\:
failure - The operation failed. The path does not point to a directory.
success - The operation succeeded.
b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.12503468-5255-46be-b010-8da8510d6cba.transition.description=The VB script file doesn't exist on the RAS machine. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.1470f884-c2ce-4b94-a45f-6e8f467e0023.prompt=Enter a value for user b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.2da238a8-5c5b-4cbc-ab33-d669e8685caf.description=Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null. Inputs\: keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable. Returns\: The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable. Responses\: isNull - if the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value. notNull - if some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.2f7cbac6-291a-446d-acb9-ab5e5da92067.description=
FSRename changes the name of a file.  This operation will not move a file to a different directory.

Input Parameters\:
source - The file to rename, including directory.
newName - The new name of the file, NOT INCLUDING DIRECTORY.
user - Username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation.
password - Password for the user.
overwrite - If false the operation will fail if newName exists (true, false).

Responses\:
failure - The rename failed.
success - The rename succeeded.
b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.31726a69-405d-40d6-8437-0cc7c9e1e7df.prompt=Enter a value for password b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.31765f6d-d632-4e62-94e2-02631be773e4.transition.description=The VB script could not be run on the remote machine. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.37f7bc97-913c-4cf1-8125-9cef6e84070b.prompt=Host to run the script against\: b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.382c541f-026b-48a0-820b-fc3016690725.transition.description=The final script name was computed. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.47f8283d-ee3b-46fc-abc0-a5fe60064847.transition.description=A random number was generated for renaming the remote file. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.48f03744-ecb2-4ead-9e8c-695acbf7736e.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.4c2666f2-ea5c-4c0d-ac21-4f01f73ec8f4.transition.description=The VB script file exists on the RAS machine. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.4e40566c-9038-4228-bd64-575f2b366a34.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.51f0818e-50be-4d5f-979a-8c8beb712482.transition.description=The VB script file couldn't be copied to the remote machine. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.6756b974-bc3c-46a0-a9b6-fb3777af018f.prompt=Enter a value for user b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.67ef0b28-3d4d-45cb-b5fc-c99bb3e24a20.description=
Generates a random number.

Inputs\:
max - The maximum number that can be returned.
min - The minimum number that can be returned.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed Successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
A random number between max and min (inclusive)
b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.6a251226-9b67-4996-be39-e1ec7ee23e35.prompt=Alternate Credentials - Password\: b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.7cbfa889-8d4f-4ae7-8791-279ee640bcb1.description=
Deletes the file or directory specified.

Input Parameters\:
source - full path to file/directory to be removed (can be a UNC path)
user - Username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host while deleting.
password - Password for the user.

Responses\:
success - The specified path was successfuly removed.
failure - Unable to remove file/directory.
b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.8504c3c4-0541-4de6-b833-316984dfd987.transition.description=The vbscript had errors and couldn't be executed successfully.The error returned when trying to run the script was\: ${scriptError}. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.8804a72c-a8c3-4b3d-9ff4-11ea567a78ba.prompt=Alternate Credentials - Password\: b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.8abebe9a-b14b-45e3-928f-91a6470c48ab.transition.description=The file with the VB script was removed from the remote machine. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.8c65a1bb-ea55-420c-a849-b29a5343a516.transition.description=The remote location exists and it is a directory. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.8de91862-630a-452c-831d-8ca37d094d8c.transition.description=The UNC path for the remote location was computed. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.8fdb6b42-9018-4281-8ac8-40b6eac9fd1f.description=
Checks to see if a path is an existing file or folder.

Inputs\:
source - The full path path to check. This can be either a local path such as c\:\test.txt, or a unc path such as \\testhost\test.txt. This path is relative to the Windows RAS host that the operation is running on.
user - Username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host when reading.
password - Password for username.

Responses\:
failure - The operation failed. The path does not exist.
success - The operation succeeded.
b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.9c38176f-34f9-479c-8f87-1613d6c525d6.transition.description=The remote location\: ${remoteLocation} doesn't exist on ${remoteHost}, or it exists but it is not a directory. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.9c6f3e40-0653-4bb0-b960-ea78606cd5ff.prompt=Remote location\: b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.9ef80710-e44a-4ba1-b1fc-cfab78742d15.transition.description=The VB script was run on the remote machine. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.a395d897-a1f4-4ab9-8e77-d6aaa179291e.prompt=Password for remote user\: b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.aa8731b3-f48a-447c-af2e-6e8681d064f2.prompt=Enter a value for Source b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.b5628c59-b7e8-45eb-b236-c9c3e275906f.prompt=Alternate Credentials - UserName\: b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.b78cbe7d-ad68-40ea-bba3-ff4e8a1d5216.prompt=Username for the remote host\: b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.bf108bd8-74d8-4bce-941a-c2fe4d9ff734.transition.description=The scriptlet executed successfully. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.ca2e8077-62fb-49e7-8510-3e4a35dfce05.description=
Copies a file or directory.

Input Parameters\:
source - The file or directory to copy.
destination - the location to copy the file or directory to.
removeSource - Specifies whether the source should be removed if the copy operation is successful (true, false).
user - Username to use for thread impersonation on the RAS host during this operation.
password - The password for the user.
overwrite - If false the operation will fail if Destination exists.

Responses\:
success - Was able to copy file/directory.
failure - Unable to copy file/directory.

Note\:
This copy operation is modeled after the Windows command-line copy operation.  So given a sample directory structure\:
--DirectoryA
   |--File1
   |--File2
   |--DirectoryC
       |-File5

--DirectoryB
   |--File3
   |--File4

If your Source is "DirectoryA" and your Destination is "DirectoryB" your end result will be\:
--DirectoryA
   |--File1
   |--File2
   |--DirectoryC
       |-File5

--DirectoryB
   |--File3
   |--File4
   |--File1
   |--File2
   |--DirectoryC
       |-File5
b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.cab4dec6-b376-4835-a97f-89d0f1708864.prompt=The full path to the script\: b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.cc53b79f-910d-4b56-b934-79d956e11367.prompt=HostName\: b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.cdeff7e5-8f39-4ecc-8a7c-f378b2a1de64.transition.description=The file with the VB script couldn't be removed from the remote machine. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.d2878f0b-fad6-4b3a-8a7c-0b9244795df7.description=
Converts a path and host into a unc path.

Inputs\:
host - the host you want to access the path on, For example\: laptop.
path - The path to access on host, For example\: c\:\temp.

Results\:
uncPath - The unc path to the specified path on the given host, its existence is not checked. So with the above inputs this would be\: \\laptop\c$\temp

Responses\:
success - unc path assembled successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.d394c590-60c4-4708-b9aa-4a30d9b38cae.description=
Uses WMI to attempt to create a remote process on a machine.  The command passed should be formatted as though it was run on the command line.

CAUTION\: internally 'cmd /c' gets prepended to the command passed.  Also '2>tempfile 1>tempfile' get appended to the command so that we can attempt to capture stdout and stderr.
So your command will look like this when executed\:
	'cmd /c [yourcommand] 2>temperr 1>tempout'

Inputs\:
host - hostname or ip address of the target machine
command - the command you want executed
user - alternate credentials username
password - alternate credentials password
outputPath - network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this     path is not accessible you should change it to use another share that the host local system account has write access to. By default, the path will have to be  changed on Windows 2000 systems
currentDirectory - current directory
characterSet - The character encoding used by the operation (for instance, windows-1252). The default is UTF-8.

Responses\:
success - remote process successfully launched and has completed executing
failure - unable to start remote process

Extra Results\:
ReturnValue - return value from WMI for starting the process (not the exit value of the process)
ProcessID - the process id of the remote process
ProcessReturnCode - the return code of the remote process
StdOut - standard output from the remote process
StdErr - standard error from the remote process
b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.d4d76701-07ac-42b2-a45f-14ef769a9dae.transition.description=A random number couldn't be generated for renaming the remote file. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.de17d42e-f521-4f46-867d-d9e66ffeb6d3.prompt=Enter a value for password b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.description=This flow copies a vbscript file from the RAS machine to a given location from a remote machine, executes the script against the remote machine and deletes the remote file once completed. The RAS and the remote hosts need to be Windows machines. 
Inputs\:
scriptLocation - The full path to the vbscript file.This should not include the host name/IP . (Ex\: c\:\test\samplescript.vbs). 
remoteHost - The host to run the script against.
remoteHostUsername - The username for connecting to the remote host.
remoteHostPassword - The password for connecting to the remote host.
remoteLocation - The full path on the remote machine where the script is to be copied and from where it will be run. This should not contain the name of the host. (Ex\: c\:\test\). If this directory doesn't exist, the flow fails.

Responses\:
success - The vbscript file was copied and run remotely, being deleted afterwards.
failure - Something went wrong.
b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.e10e9566-e8f1-4223-905f-a3ff4885a317.prompt=Alternate Credentials - UserName\: b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.e1c564d4-75a8-4556-94a5-56c218d9fc27.transition.description=The remote script file couldn't be renamed. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.e3888bdf-c88d-4a99-9e55-c25cd19a3786.transition.description=The VB script file was copied to the remote machine. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.ea752175-2407-499a-85f1-4f3f7c5bba91.transition.description=The remote script file was renamed successfully. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.ef45359a-f3e9-41f8-ad33-a3f041761bf6.transition.description=The initial script name was retrieved. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.f23557bf-2f5b-433c-8a50-4a0318a870ac.transition.description=The UNC path for the remote location can not be computed. b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.fac88a14-ced7-4ae5-bc83-8d072b838f5f.prompt=Source FileName\: b6b343a7-28cd-4efe-a05a-aa287f8e0b86.fc67c994-fb31-47d1-bf72-4458fc5c850c.prompt=Destination\:
flow.name: Copy and Run Script

scriptlet.name: default
default
